source.title: Next.js 16 | Next.js
source.description: Next.js 16 release notes covering Cache Components, Turbopack stable, proxy.ts replacing middleware, React Compiler, Build Adapters API, enhanced routing, caching APIs, React 19.2 features, and breaking changes.

source.title: Getting Started: Image Optimization | Next.js
source.description: Next.js Image component for automatic size optimisation, WebP format, lazy loading, blur placeholders, local images from public folder with automatic dimensions, remote images requiring width/height props, and remotePatterns security configuration.

source.title: Getting Started: Project Structure | Next.js
source.description: Folder and file conventions including top-level folders, routing files (layout, page, loading, error, route), dynamic routes, route groups, private folders, parallel and intercepted routes, metadata conventions, colocation patterns, component hierarchy.

source.title: Getting Started: Installation | Next.js
source.description: Installation methods using create-next-app CLI or manual setup, system requirements, configuration prompts for TypeScript, linting, Tailwind, App Router, creating app directory with layout and page files, development server, and absolute imports.

source.title: Configuration: TypeScript | Next.js
source.description: Next.js TypeScript configuration including IDE plugin, statically typed links, environment variable IntelliSense, custom tsconfig paths, build error handling, end-to-end type safety, and route-aware type helpers.

source.title: Getting Started: Layouts and Pages | Next.js
source.description: File-system routing with page and layout files, nested routes, dynamic segments using square brackets, nested layouts wrapping children, search parameters handling, Link component for navigation, and PageProps LayoutProps type helpers.

source.title: Testing: Vitest | Next.js
source.description: Setting up Vitest with Next.js: quickstart example, manual installation, configuration with jsdom and React Testing Library, creating unit tests for components, running tests, and limitations with async Server Components.

source.title: Testing: Playwright | Next.js
source.description: Setting up Playwright with Next.js for E2E testing: quickstart example, manual installation, creating navigation tests, running tests against production build, using webServer feature, and CI configuration with headless mode.

source.title: Guides: Testing | Next.js
source.description: Testing overview covering unit testing, component testing, integration testing, end-to-end testing, snapshot testing, async Server Components recommendations, and setup guides for Cypress, Jest, Playwright, and Vitest.

source.title: Testing: Jest | Next.js
source.description: Setting up Jest with Next.js for unit and snapshot testing including installation, configuration with next/jest transformer, handling module path aliases, custom matchers setup, creating test scripts, and example component tests.

source.title: API Reference: Turbopack | Next.js
source.description: Turbopack Rust-based incremental bundler for Next.js, unified graph architecture, lazy bundling, language support (JavaScript, TypeScript, JSX, CSS, Sass, PostCSS), Fast Refresh, React Server Components, webpack gaps, configuration options, trace generation.

source.title: Configuration: next.config.js | Next.js
source.description: Next.js configuration reference covering ECMAScript modules, TypeScript support, async functions, phase-based configuration, unit testing utilities, and comprehensive options including headers, redirects, rewrites, images, caching, and routing.

source.title: next.config.js: serverComponentsHmrCache | Next.js
source.description: Experimental configuration option to cache fetch responses in Server Components across HMR refreshes during development, reducing API costs and improving response times, with default behaviour and opt-out instructions.

source.title: Getting Started: Updating Data | Next.js
source.description: Server Functions and Server Actions with use server directive, creating and invoking from components, forms with FormData, event handlers, useActionState, revalidatePath, revalidateTag, redirect, refresh, cookies API, useEffect patterns.

source.title: Functions: generateMetadata | Next.js
source.description: Static metadata object and generateMetadata function for dynamic metadata, including title templates, description, openGraph, Twitter cards, robots, icons, viewport, verification, alternates, metadataBase, and streaming metadata support.

source.title: File-system conventions: Metadata Files | Next.js
source.description: Metadata file conventions including favicon, icon, apple-icon, manifest.json, Open Graph and Twitter images, robots.txt, and sitemap.xml. Covers static and dynamic variants, automatic serving with caching, and head element updates.

source.title: Getting Started: Font Optimization | Next.js
source.description: Using next/font module for automatic font optimisation with built-in self-hosting, Google fonts via next/font/google, local fonts via next/font/local, variable fonts, weight specification, className application, and preventing layout shift.

source.title: Components: Font | Next.js
source.description: Font optimization with automatic self-hosting for Google and local fonts, configuration options (weight, style, subsets, display, preload, fallback, variable), Tailwind integration, className/style/CSS variable application methods.

source.title: Getting Started: Fonts | Next.js
source.description: Automatic font optimization via next/font with self-hosting, zero layout shift, Google Font integration supporting variable fonts, local font imports from single or multiple files, className application, eliminating external requests.

source.title: Missing Suspense boundary with useSearchParams | Next.js
source.description: Error explanation and solutions for missing Suspense boundary with useSearchParams, including wrapping in Suspense, using connection function for dynamic rendering, passing searchParams from Server Components, and debugging with --debug-prerender flag.

source.title: Getting Started: Cache Components | Next.js
source.description: Cache Components enabling Partial Prerendering for static, cached, and dynamic rendering. Static HTML shell, Suspense streaming, use cache directive, cacheLife/cacheTag functions, runtime data handling, Activity navigation, route segment config migration.

source.title: Getting Started: Linking and Navigating | Next.js
source.description: Navigation and rendering including Link component prefetching, static and dynamic server rendering, streaming with loading.tsx and Suspense, client-side transitions, useLinkStatus for slow networks, generateStaticParams, hydration optimisation, and native History API.

source.title: Getting Started: Caching and Revalidating | Next.js
source.description: Caching and revalidation APIs including fetch with force-cache and next.revalidate, cacheTag with use cache directive, revalidateTag with stale-while-revalidate, updateTag for Server Actions, revalidatePath, and legacy unstable_cache.

source.title: Guides: Caching | Next.js
source.description: Four caching mechanisms including Request Memoization, Data Cache, Full Route Cache, and Router Cache. Static and dynamic rendering strategies, time-based and on-demand revalidation, cache interactions, and API reference.

source.title: Getting Started: Proxy | Next.js
source.description: Next.js Proxy (formerly Middleware) for running code before requests complete, modifying responses via rewrites, redirects, header modifications, use cases, proxy.ts file convention, path matching configuration.

source.title: Getting Started: Fetching Data | Next.js
source.description: Data fetching in Server and Client Components using fetch, ORMs, React use hook, SWR; streaming with Suspense and loading.js; deduplication, caching, sequential, parallel, and preloading patterns.

source.title: File-system conventions: loading.js | Next.js
source.description: loading.js special file convention for creating instant loading states with React Suspense, streaming behaviour, navigation interruptibility, SEO considerations, status codes, platform support, and manual Suspense boundaries implementation.

source.title: Uncached data was accessed outside of `<Suspense>` | Next.js
source.description: Blocking route error when uncached data is accessed outside Suspense boundaries with cacheComponents enabled, covering fixes using use cache directive, Suspense boundaries, headers cookies params handling, and short-lived cache configurations.

source.title: Guides: Production | Next.js
source.description: Production optimisation checklist covering automatic optimisations, routing and rendering patterns, data fetching and caching, UI accessibility, security practices, metadata and SEO, type safety, Core Web Vitals monitoring, and bundle analysis.
